content:
HwndSourceParameters Struct

In this Article

Contains the parameters that are used to create an HwndSource object using the stem.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.#ctor* constructor.

Syntax

Declaration

public struct HwndSourceParameters

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • HwndSourceParameters

Remarks

This structure is used only in the HwndSource object constructor call.

The properties whose values are established by this structure are not directly exposed on HwndSource instances when an HwndSource is constructed. However, the values of the HwndSourceParameters structure typically affect general UI properties such as "Height" and "Width" that might exist in specific hosted objects and their APIs.

Important

Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor. An HwndSourceParameters instance that is created by the default constructor results in HwndSourceParameters that cannot be assigned a WindowName (even though the WindowName property appears to be settable). If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an HwndSource constructor, the resulting HwndSourcecannot display a window.

Constructors summary

HwndSourceParameters(String)

Initializes a new instance of the HwndSourceParameters class with a specified window name.
HwndSourceParameters(String,Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the HwndSourceParameters class with a specified window name and initial size.

Properties summary

AcquireHwndFocusInMenuMode

Gets or sets the value that determines whether to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when an HwndSource is created.
AdjustSizingForNonClientArea

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include the nonclient area for sizing.
ExtendedWindowStyle

Gets or sets the extended Microsoft Windows styles for the window.
HasAssignedSize

Gets a value that indicates whether a size was assigned.
Height

Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the window.
HwndSourceHook

Gets or sets the message hook for the window.
ParentWindow

Gets or sets the window handle (HWND) of the parent for the created window.
PositionX

Gets or sets the left-edge position of the window.
PositionY

Gets or sets the upper-edge position of the window.
RestoreFocusMode

Gets or sets how WPF handles restoring focus to the window.
TreatAncestorsAsNonClientArea

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parent windows of the HwndSource should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.
TreatAsInputRoot

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the HwndSource should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the ComponentDispatcher.
UsesPerPixelOpacity

Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel opacity of the source window content is respected.
UsesPerPixelTransparency

Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel transparency of the source window content is respected.
Width

Gets or sets a value that indicates the width of the window.
WindowClassStyle

Gets or sets the Microsoft Windows class style for the window.
WindowName

Gets or sets the name of the window.
WindowStyle

Gets or sets the style for the window.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified object.
Equals(HwndSourceParameters)

Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified HwndSourceParameters structure.
GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this HwndSourceParameters instance.
SetPosition(Int32,Int32)

Sets the values that are used for the screen position of the window for the HwndSource.
SetSize(Int32,Int32)

Sets the values that are used for the window size of the HwndSource.

Operators summary

op_Equality(HwndSourceParameters,HwndSourceParameters)

Determines whether an HwndSourceParameters structure is equal to another HwndSourceParameters structure.
op_Inequality(HwndSourceParameters,HwndSourceParameters)

Determines whether an HwndSourceParameters structure is not equal to another HwndSourceParameters structure.

Constructors

  • HwndSourceParameters(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the HwndSourceParameters class with a specified window name.

    public HwndSourceParameters (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The window's name.

  • HwndSourceParameters(String,Int32,Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the HwndSourceParameters class with a specified window name and initial size.

    public HwndSourceParameters (string name, int width, int height);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The window's name.

    • width
      Int32

      The window's width, in pixels.

    • height
      Int32

      The window's height, in pixels.

    Remarks

    Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the width or height parameters. Although the method eventually succeeds, even if you do pass 0, a significant performance penalty occurs.

Properties

  • AcquireHwndFocusInMenuMode

    Gets or sets the value that determines whether to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when an HwndSource is created.

    public bool AcquireHwndFocusInMenuMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when the user interacts with menus; otherwise, false. null to use the value of stem.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.DefaultAcquireHwndFocusInMenuMode*.

  • AdjustSizingForNonClientArea

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include the nonclient area for sizing.

    public bool AdjustSizingForNonClientArea { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the layout manager sizing logic should include the nonclient area; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    The Window class sets this parameter to true when using this structure internally, as part of its Win32 window-creation process.

  • ExtendedWindowStyle

    Gets or sets the extended Microsoft Windows styles for the window.

    public int ExtendedWindowStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The extended window styles. See CreateWindowEx for a list of these styles. The default is 0 (no extended window styles).

  • HasAssignedSize

    Gets a value that indicates whether a size was assigned.

    public bool HasAssignedSize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the window size was assigned; otherwise, false. The default is false, unless the structure was created with provided height and width, in which case the value is true.

    Remarks

    If a size was not assigned, the window has the default size.

    Calls to SetSize or setting Width or Height all result in this property being true.

  • Height

    Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the window.

    public int Height { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The height of the window, in device pixels. The default value is 1.

    Remarks

    Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), you specify this window size in device pixels, not the typical device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set SizeToContent to true.

    Do not set Height to 0 (zero). Doing so incurs a significant performance penalty in rendering.

  • HwndSourceHook

    Gets or sets the message hook for the window.

    public System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceHook HwndSourceHook { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • HwndSourceHook

      The message hook for the window.

    Remarks

    This message hook is enabled before CreateWindow is called so that it receives all the window creation messages.

  • ParentWindow

    Gets or sets the window handle (HWND) of the parent for the created window.

    public IntPtr ParentWindow { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IntPtr

      The HWND of the parent window.

  • PositionX

    Gets or sets the left-edge position of the window.

    public int PositionX { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The left-edge position of the window. The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.

  • PositionY

    Gets or sets the upper-edge position of the window.

    public int PositionY { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The upper-edge position of the window. The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.

  • RestoreFocusMode

    Gets or sets how WPF handles restoring focus to the window.

    public System.Windows.Input.RestoreFocusMode RestoreFocusMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • RestoreFocusMode

      One of the enumeration values that specifies how WPF handles restoring focus for the window. The default is RestoreFocusMode.

    Remarks

    WPF automatically tries to restore focus to the window unless RestoreFocusMode is set to RestoreFocusMode.

  • TreatAncestorsAsNonClientArea

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parent windows of the HwndSource should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.

    public bool TreatAncestorsAsNonClientArea { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if parent windows of the HwndSource should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.; otherwise, false. The default is false.

  • TreatAsInputRoot

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the HwndSource should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the ComponentDispatcher.

    public bool TreatAsInputRoot { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the HwndSource should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the ComponentDispatcher; otherwise, false. The default is true if the HwndSource corresponds to a top-level window; otherwise, the default is false.

  • UsesPerPixelOpacity

    Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel opacity of the source window content is respected.

    public bool UsesPerPixelOpacity { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if using per-pixel opacity; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    By enabling per-pixel opacity, the system no longer draws the non-client area.

    The opacity is used when the window is drawn on the desktop (it represents a final rendering step and does not appear as a contributor to property values such as Opacity).

    UsesPerPixelOpacity applies only to top-level windows.

  • UsesPerPixelTransparency

    Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel transparency of the source window content is respected.

    public bool UsesPerPixelTransparency { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if using per-pixel transparency; otherwise, false.

  • Width

    Gets or sets a value that indicates the width of the window.

    public int Width { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The window width, in device pixels. The default value is 1.

    Remarks

    Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen region measures in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), you specify this window's size in device pixels, not in the usual device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set SizeToContent to true.

    Do not set Width to 0 (zero). Doing so incurs a substantial performance penalty in rendering.

  • WindowClassStyle

    Gets or sets the Microsoft Windows class style for the window.

    public int WindowClassStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The window class style. See Window Class Styles for detailed information. The default is 0 (no window class style).

  • WindowName

    Gets or sets the name of the window.

    public string WindowName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The window name.

    Remarks

    Important

    Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor. An HwndSourceParameters instance that is created by the default constructor results in HwndSourceParameters that cannot be assigned a WindowName (even though the WindowName property appears to be settable). If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an HwndSource constructor, the resulting HwndSource cannot display a window.

  • WindowStyle

    Gets or sets the style for the window.

    public int WindowStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The window style. See the CreateWindowEx function for a complete list of style bits. See Remarks for defaults.

    Remarks

    By default, the following bits are set when the structure is created: WS_VISIBLE; WS_CAPTION; WS_SYSMENU; WS_THICKFRAME; WS_MINIMIZEBOX; WS_MAXIMIZEBOX; WS_CLIPCHILDREN.

    For a standard window, you must set the WS_CLIPCHILDREN bit. This style bit is enforced in the code itself; if you omit to set this flag, WPF adds it to whatever value you provide.

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified object.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The objects to be tested for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the comparison is equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.

  • Equals(HwndSourceParameters)

    Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified HwndSourceParameters structure.

    public bool Equals (System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      HwndSourceParameters

      The structure to be tested for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the structures are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.

  • GetHashCode()

    Returns the hash code for this HwndSourceParameters instance.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

    Remarks

    This implementation uses the Object implementation of GetHashCode.

  • SetPosition(Int32,Int32)

    Sets the values that are used for the screen position of the window for the HwndSource.

    public void SetPosition (int x, int y);

    Parameters

    • x
      Int32

      The position of the left edge of the window.

    • y
      Int32

      The position of the upper edge of the window.

  • SetSize(Int32,Int32)

    Sets the values that are used for the window size of the HwndSource.

    public void SetSize (int width, int height);

    Parameters

    • width
      Int32

      The width of the window, in device pixels.

    • height
      Int32

      The height of the window, in device pixels.

    Remarks

    Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), you specify this window size in device pixels, not in the typical device-independent units. If you need to size your window to its content, set SizeToContent to true.

    Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the width or height parameters. Although the method eventually succeeds even if you do pass 0, a substantial performance penalty occurs.

Operators

  • op_Equality(HwndSourceParameters,HwndSourceParameters)

    Determines whether an HwndSourceParameters structure is equal to another HwndSourceParameters structure.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters a, System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters b);

    Parameters

    • a
      HwndSourceParameters

      The first HwndSourceParameters structure to compare.

    • b
      HwndSourceParameters

      The second HwndSourceParameters structure to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the structures are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This implementation calls the Equals method.

  • op_Inequality(HwndSourceParameters,HwndSourceParameters)

    Determines whether an HwndSourceParameters structure is not equal to another HwndSourceParameters structure.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters a, System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters b);

    Parameters

    • a
      HwndSourceParameters

      The first HwndSourceParameters structure to compare.

    • b
      HwndSourceParameters

      The second HwndSourceParameters structure to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the structures are not equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This implementation calls the Equals method and inverts the result.
